title.narrative: Liberia Household Income and Expenditure Survey

description.narrative: Improved capacity of the national statistics system in provision of national accounts, price and poverty data, and baseline indicators for the Agenda for Transformation.

The World Bank has applied to the Embassy for funding of 4,900,000 SEK (approximately USD 600,000) to carry out the Liberia Household Income and Expenditure Survey during 2015-2016.
The intervention aims to improve the capacity of the national statistics system in Liberia, in provision of national accounts, price and poverty data and baseline indicators for the Agenda for Transformation. The aim is set to be achieved through the completion of a 12-month Household Income and Expenditure Survey, covering seasonal variations.
The intervention's total budget is USD 3,796,061. The other donors are USAID and the EU. The Liberian government is also funding the intervention.

Världsbanken har ansökt till ambassaden om finansiering på 4 900 000 SEK (ungefär 600 000 USD) för att genomföra projektet Liberia Household Income and Expenditure Survey under 2015-2016.
Projektet syftar till att förbättra kapaciteten hos det nationella statistiksystemet i Liberia, i tillhandahållandet av nationalräkenskaperna, pris- och fattigdomsdata och indikatorer för den liberianska fattigdomsstrategin, Agenda for Transformation. Syftet ska uppnås genom genomförandet av en 12 månader lång undersökning om hushållens inkomster och utgifter, som täcker säsongsvariationer.
Insatsens totala budget är 3 796 061 USD. Övriga givare är USAID och EU. Även den liberianska regeringen tillför medel.

participating-org.narrative: IBRD/International Bank for Reconstruction and Development/The World Bank

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The Strengthening the National Statistics System project was a multi-year programme running from 2013 to 2018. Under the project the following surveys were conducted, the Household Income & Expenditure Survey (HIES 2014), the Household Income & Expenditure Survey (HIES 2016), Crop Cutting Survey 2014 & 2015, Agriculture Recall Survey 2016, the National Establishment Census (2017) and the National Accounts Annual Survey (NAAS 2018). Through the successful completion of these key surveys, the Liberia Institute of Statistics & Geo-Information Systems (LISGIS) was able to reach the project targets including a detailed poverty analysis, the construction of the Consumer Price Index, an update of the National Accounts and social and economic indicators to track the progress of the previous development plan the Agenda for Transformation.Moreover, the most recent HIES 2016, provides detailed poverty, employment, health, gender and agricultural analyses which serve as baseline information for the “Pro-Poor Agenda for Prosperity and Development” being developed by the Government of Liberia, and provides insight into international benchmarks such as the Sustainable Development Goals. Other components of this project include capacity building and cross-country knowledge sharing, alongside efforts to improve survey methodologies in Liberia. The project was implemented by Liberia Institute of Statistics and Geo-Information Services (LISGIS), with support from Government of Liberia (GoL), United States Agency for International Development (USAID), European Union (EU), World Bank (WB), African Development Bank (AfDB) and Swedish International Development Agency (SIDA).
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
